itemDescription: British apiculturist and expert on bee diseases

wikipedia_page.main: Annie Dorothy Betts (1884 - 8 September 1961) was a British apiculturist, bee disease expert, author and editor. She made scientifically significant observations on honeybees, wrote books on apiculture, and edited the journal Bee World.

response: Bettsia is a genus of fungi within the Ascosphaeraceae family. This is a monotypic genus, containing the single species Bettsia alvei. Alvei was first described by Annie Betts and this genus is named for her.
